1-1: The Basmala (Bismillah) - 'In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.' This is the opening verse that Muslims begin with in all important matters. Ar-Rahman and Ar-Raheem are two of Allah's beautiful names indicating His vast mercy.
1-2: Al-Hamdu lillahi Rabbil 'Alamin - The surah opens with praise to Allah, acknowledging Him as the Lord of all worlds, the Owner and Sustainer of everything.
2-255: Ayat al-Kursi (The Throne Verse) - The greatest verse in the Quran. It contains the pure essence of Tawheed (monotheism) and describes Allah's supreme attributes including His eternal life, His sustaining power, His all-encompassing knowledge, and His vast dominion.
36-1: Ya-Sin - One of the disconnected letters at the beginning of certain surahs. Allah knows best their meaning. Many hadiths mention the special virtues of this surah.
55-13: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny? - This verse is repeated 31 times in Surah Ar-Rahman, serving as a powerful reminder of Allah's countless blessings and a warning against denying or being ungrateful for them.
